Post-Match Reflections: The Diamondbacks have won the National League pennant and are going to the World Series.
Manager Torey Lovullo wants to make sure that Chris ‘Mad Dog’ Russo does not cheat his way out of his prediction that he would retire if the Diamondbacks won Games 6 and 7 in Philadelphia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks have defied expectations throughout the season and playoffs.
The team has shown resilience and consistency in their performances.
Corbin Carroll is the first player in MLB history with three or more hits and two or more stolen bases in a Game 7.
The Diamondbacks have been a story of redemption, having lost 110 games just two years ago.
They are the fifth team in MLB history to go from a 100-plus loss season to a World Series berth in the span of two years, and the first to do so from 110 or more losses.
Others: The Rangers are a formidable opponent and have already opened as favorites in the World Series.
Being seen as the underdog is familiar territory for the Diamondbacks.
